titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Marmaduke Earle register of marriages in Oyster Bay 1973.154
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:10:45 +0000.

did.unittitle: Marmaduke Earle register of marriages in Oyster Bay
did.abstract: One handwritten register created by Reverend Marmaduke Earle (1769-1856) of marriages occurring in the Long Island town of Oyster Bay throughout the period 1802 to 1855.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One handwritten register of marriages occurring in the Long Island town of Oyster Bay throughout the period 1802 to 1855. The register was created by the Reverend Marmaduke Earle, and the marriages recorded are presumed to have been performed by him. The register notes the dates of each marriage ceremony, as well as the names of the individuals who were married.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Marmaduke Earle register of marriages in Oyster Bay, 1973.154, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Reverend Marmaduke Earle (1769-1856) was a minister who served congregations in Stamford, Connecticut and Oyster Bay, Long Island.
